chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob A Spencer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob A Spencer was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.
*   Pay extradition costs totaling $421.84.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or dscruptive groups.  May not have contact with any individuals who use or traffic in controlled substance.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Credit for 2 days.
Huber & Work Crew authorized.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME - To complete the Living Free Program.  -  NO huber for employment or treatment.
***JOC IS AMENDED AS FOLLOWS:  CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME EFFECTIVE 5/5/17 AND RELEASE ON 8/12/17
AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO REVOCATION AS OF 1/19/18 -  With credit since the 1/10/18 order to detain.  Huber for employment and treatment

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Continue to pay all court obligations.    
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jacob A Spencer, appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 120 days in the KCJ commencing on 4/2/16 at 8:00 AM.  Credit for 2 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Restitution to be determined through restitution hearing before Comm. Dowse.  DE is ordered to pay extradition costs in the amount of $421.84.  Costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.  ***Amended minutes - May not have contact w/ any individuals who use or traffic in controlled substance. - jk
Defendant's copy of Notice of Hearing for 3/18/16 returned by the USPS; Unclaimed - Unable to Forward
Sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 11:30 am

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jacob A Spencer, appeared in court.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rufo is unavailable today so Sentencing is rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty Andrea Rufo appeared for def., who is caught in traffic and on his way to court.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is set for sentencing today.  Atty Rufo has been unable to review the PSI with def. due to her illness.  Sentencing hearing adj. to 3/2/16 at 10:45.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Andrea Rufo.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Voluntary appearance.  Authorizations for bench warrant and signature bond forfeiture are vacated.  Counts 2 and 3 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 2/10/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.
At request of Atty Rufo, voluntary appearance scheduled for 12/9/15 at 8:40.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty Andrea Rufo appeared for def.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. did not appear.  Case set for 8:40 a.m.; case called at 8:48 a.m.  Signature bond ordered forfeited.  Bench warrant to issue; bond set at $4,000.00 cash.  All orders stayed until 12/8/15 to allow Atty Rufo time to contact def. and schedule a voluntary appearance.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jacob A Spencer, appeared with Attorney James Fields-Bowers specially for Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Atty FIelds-Bowers provided an updated address for De and requests an adjournment on behalf of Atty Rufo who is unable to appear today; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:40 am.

Defendant, Jacob A Spencer, appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
